intro: Breyniopsis, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous, and thrive in rocky or arid environments. Breyniopsis species are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, four-petaled flowers. They are often found in regions with Mediterranean or temperate climates. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
